ACT
149
Determining the identity of the testator and witness
According to the rules of this Act, the authorized person shall determine the identity of the testator and the witness, if he does not know them personally and by name.
If the authorized person does not know the testator personally and by name, he will confirm his identity with an identity card or passport. If this is not possible, its identity will be established by the testimony of two legally competent witnesses to the identity.
The identity of testamentary witnesses whom the authorized person does not know personally and by name will be established in the manner provided for establishing the identity of the testator.
The identity of witnesses to the identity will be established on the basis of their identity cards or passports.
A person who is a witness of identity can also be a witness to a will.
The minutes shall state how the identity of the testator, witness to the will and witness to identity was established.
